newsitem.title: USA: US Treasury 3-yr notes sold at average 6.041 pct.
newsitem.headline: US Treasury 3-yr notes sold at average 6.041 pct.

text.p: The U.S. Treasury's auction of $16.0 billion in three-year notes on Tuesday produced average yields of 6.041 percent, in line with expectations. The data had little effect on Treasury prices, however.
The bid-to-cover ratio was 2.45 with noncompetitive bids at $931 million, strong compared to recent auctions, analysts said.

The sale had been expected to go well, with investors seen as being attracted to that maturity spectrum at levels above 6.0 percent. Treasury will sell 10- and 30-year issues on Wednesday and Thursday.
